page.title: 12 FORT PERZERIES
page.content: Fort Perzeries was built to provide against possible landing in the southern half of Rocquaine Bay and in 1680 two 3 1/2 inch cannons called sakers were mounted there.The British War Office handed the Fort over to the States of{Guernsey}in 1848. During the occupation a small garrison of Germans were stationed there. In 1981 excavations revealed the original 17th. century gun platform and restoration work was carried out on the walls. There is a gun battery on top of Les Pezeries which overlooks the whole of Rocquaine Bay stretching across to L'Eree Bay. By {JOHN NOBES.
